reviews.review_msg: terrible class, boring and dry material. The prof sits there to read through his slides. Basically makes you suffer in all ways.

There were a lot of readings for the course, but they were all relevant to the course content.  John clearly lays out material and explains the concepts thoroughly; ask questions as they are encouraged and some of the material is complex and dense.  Of all the English courses I've taken (I've taken a fair few), John is the best prof I've had.

Taken during COVID so it was online. JD is a very caring prof and definitely loves the subject of literary criticisms. It reminded me more of a philosophy class, although it was still interesting. He likes asking big questions even if he himself can't answer them during tutorials, which gives students a lot to think about for future discussions.

This prof is a nice man who is very passionate about his work, but he is very tough grader. He doesn't give clear criteria for anything and then marks super hard because you didn't write the way he wanted you to. I spent a lot of time on this class and put in a lot of effort and am not expecting a grade that I would like. I'd skip this prof.
JD is a good lecturer, but a tough marker. Be prepared to work hard and still not get the grade you wanted.

JD is a great prof! I enjoy his lecture style and the way he makes the material engaging. His classes are lecture heavy, but it is always reasonable, just come ready to listen and write! I would recommend anyone to take a class with JD, he makes English awesome!

Carolyn is a super nice lady and extremely knowledgeable - but this course is way too difficult for a lower division course. Assignments were unclear and very open to interpretation - with marking that doesnt fully explain what you are doing incorrect. However, she is always available for help when asked. Make sure to participate in all lectures.

Carolyn is really nice and approachable. Very knowledgeable but not at all arrogant. She got to know everyone well. The 3-hour seminar went by much faster than all of my other 2-hour lectures... class was always interesting and thought-provoking. The reading material seemed difficult at first but with time became easier. Would definitely recommend!

Fleming is really knowledgeable professor and you can see his passion come out in his lecture style. No slides posted and the readings were pretty dry, but if you show up and take detailed notes you will do fine on the papers and the final exam! Super patient guy and was willing to take extra time when the class was struggling with certain topics.

Fleming is a character for sure. Enjoyed his class although the content was all over the place. He is a fair marker and leaves lots of comments on your papers. The papers themselves also have very broad topics with not much constraining criteria which personally I liked. Would take another class with him, but 216 was not my favourite.
Great prof! Very smart and interesting. Funny too! Seems like a fair marker so far. Probably deserves two chili peppers too!!!
